author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Central force also displays the latest non-lethal weapons

Rapid Action Force (RAF), which was conducting a familiarisation exercise in the district, demonstrated crowd control techniques to Armed Reserve (AR) police personnel here on Sunday.

A 50-member RAF platoon, headed by Deputy Commandant K.V. Kuriakose, presented a live demonstration of how to control crowd and prevent outbreak of violence by using various barriers and gas shells.

The force also demonstrated the formations to be adopted while entering a violent terrain, especially in lanes and by-lanes, Assistant Commandant of the platoon K.C. Raja said.

The commandos taught firing of tear gas shells, use of other barriers and strategies to be adopted to bring the crowd under control. The force also displayed the latest non-lethal weapons being used for controlling violent mobs, he said.

A.D. Mohan Raj, Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP), District Crime Bureau, holding additional charge as DSP, AR Police, said that the demonstration was useful to the force, which was engaged in trouble shooting situations. About 200 police personnel, including women police, were benefited by the exercise, he said.

The RAF has been visiting the district as part of its routine exercise after the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) identified the district as sensitive following a report from the Intelligence Bureau (IB).

RAF platoons visit sensitive districts in the State once in two years and hyper-sensitive districts once a year to instil confidence in the minds of the people and send a strong message to antisocial and anti-national elements.
title: RAF demonstrates crowd control techniques
